subject: Re: More experiments.
author: psi_research
full_text:
Radionics is the art and science of manipulating the energy of
organisms. One of the steps is to "tune" the individual energy
signature of the target you want to affect. It is a non-local action
so the effect can take place anywhere no matter how far the target is
from the machine operator. This "tuning" is what attracts me to see if
the combination scrying on the stick pad while adjusting a frequency
dial can in any way be useful to ITC work.
 
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
>
> I've heard of the Hieronymus machine, but don't remember, or don't
know what 
> it is. I think what would help the plastic is that conductive spray
coating 
> that's used on laptop cases. I also wantt to try double sided copper
clad PC 
> board.
> 
> Frank-S
> 
> 
> >From: Zack Widup <w9sz@...>
> >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More experiments.
> >Date: Mon, 16 Jul 2007 23:34:43 -0500 (CDT)
> >
> >On Mon, 16 Jul 2007, Frank Sumption wrote:
> >
> > > This time I made a small plastic echo box. I tried plastic years
ago, 
> >and it
> > > didn't work, this time it seems to. The injection speaker
accounts for 
> >the
> > > weaker voices I think, since it's an ear bud, and is 32 ohm, normal 
> >speakers
> > > are 8 ohms. More voices are in my folder.
> > >
> >
> >There are so many different types of plastics with so many different
> >characteristics ... ABS plastic, PVC, Delrin, acrylic, PTFE (teflon),
> >Cyrolon ZX ...
> >
> >It might be interesting to experiment with different types and see what
> >works the best.
> >
> >Anyone here ever build a Hieronymus machine?  I understand teflon (or
> >fiberglass-teflon PC board material) works incredibly well for the
> >"stick" sensor plate.
> >
> >Zack
> >
